name: St. John of God

locations.description: Founder of the Brothers Hospitallers of St. John of God in Granada, patron saint of hospitals and the sick

summary: John of God was a Portuguese-born Spanish Catholic who founded the Brothers Hospitallers of St. John of God, a religious order dedicated to caring for the sick and poor. After a conversion experience, he dedicated his life to serving the sick in Granada, establishing hospitals and care facilities. He is the patron saint of hospitals, nurses, and the sick.
